declarations.name: MultiSelect
declarations.summary: A multi-select dropdown for choosing multiple options
declarations.description: An accessible multi-select component that allows users to choose multiple options from a dropdown list. Use this component when you need to provide a list of selectable items. It MUST be used within a form context and SHOULD include a label for accessibility. The component provides keyboard navigation with Tab, Enter, and Space keys for focus management. It follows WCAG 2.1 AA guidelines and includes ARIA attributes for screen reader support.

members.name: options
members.description: The list of available options to display in the dropdown. Each option provides a label and value for form submission.

members.name: value
members.description: The currently selected values. When multiple selections are made, this array contains all selected option values.

attributes.name: options
attributes.description: The list of available options to display in the dropdown. Each option provides a label and value for form submission.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The currently selected values. When multiple selections are made, this array contains all selected option values.

slots.description: Default slot for child option elements. Accepts inline text content or custom option nodes with aria-role attributes.

slots.name: label
slots.description: Slot for the label element. Content should be accessible text that screen readers can announce.

cssParts.name: listbox
cssParts.description: The dropdown list container. Use design tokens for consistent theme spacing.

cssParts.name: option
cssParts.description: Individual option elements in the list. Apply theme colors via design tokens.

cssProperties.name: --multi-select-max-height
cssProperties.description: Maximum height of the dropdown. Maps to the design system spacing token scale.

cssProperties.name: --multi-select-option-padding
cssProperties.description: Padding for each option. Use design token values for consistent spacing.

events.name: change
events.description: Fired when the selection changes. The event detail contains the new list of selected values.

events.name: open
events.description: Dispatched when the dropdown opens. The detail property includes the trigger source.

demos.description: Basic usage example showing multi-select with predefined options
